attributes.action: Protect those being bullied in our schools by lowering the age of responsibility
attributes.background:
Lower the age to protect children and young people who suffer horrific injuries at the hands of bullies.
I had my arm broken 14 years ago by bullies, so this isn't stopping happening to others! 
Recently 7 year old Jak had his head bashed into a metal pole, leaving him with a horrific head injury.
attributes.additional_details: http://metro.co.uk/2017/04/09/mum-shares-picture-of-son-7-after-bullies-pushed-him-into-metal-pole-6563641/

attributes.action: Make it law for the whole of the UK  to vote in the London Mayor elections.
attributes.background: The London Mayor, Mr Khan is proposing Taxes on certain vehicles in  London. It is unfair that the Tax paying people in the rest of the UK should be subject to Taxes proposed by a Mayor who we are not allowed to vote for.
attributes.additional_details: This is a time when the whole of the UK should be working together as one, not by being excluded from important votes that will affect our whole country. If we are all subject to this, then we should all be allowed the vote. London is the capital for all, not just a few.

attributes.action: Introduce tick control for dogs before, during and after travel abroad
attributes.background: In 2012 the requirement for dogs entering the UK to be treated against ticks was lifted. Dogs picking up ticks abroad may be exposed to disease pathogens not present in the UK and allowing untreated pets into the UK risks importing non-native tick species which may potentially carry fatal disease.
attributes.additional_details:
The 2015 Big Tick Project demonstrated that dogs who had travelled outside the UK prior to the study, returned carrying a tick. The study found that of the 56 pets examined who had travelled, 76% were carrying a tick. Analysis of the ticks in the study showed the presence of the potentially fatal disease Canine Babesiosis in a tick from a dog who returned from France.
Two dogs died after Canine Babesiosis was found in the UK last year for the first time in dogs who had not travelled abroad.

attributes.action: Stop decision to deny access to new medicines for those with ultra-rare diseases
attributes.background: NICE and NHS England’s decision to deny access to new medicines from 1 April 2017 for those suffering from ultra-rare diseases, is about to change the lives of thousands of vulnerable, ill people all over England. Medical treatments will be denied, thus condemning those affected to an early death.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.mpssociety.org.uk/2017/03/28/press-release-nice-nhs-englands-decision-deny-access-new-medicines-no-april-fools-joke/
This is specific to MPS and related diseases, but there are many other ultra-rare diseases within England which also be affected, this petition is to cover all of these diseases. This petition is not to condemn the whole proposal made by NICE and NHS, but to amend decisions within it, mainly the access to new medicines.
More information can be found via the NICE website

attributes.action: Allow courtesy light in personal vehicles when responding to emergency callouts.
attributes.background: Retained firefighters, lowland search & rescue, and lifeboat crew members all respond to emergency callouts in their personal vehicles, often tackling busy traffic. The use of a courtesy light could warn other motorist of an emergency response, which could be the difference in life or death.

attributes.action: Object strongly in the use of children for the mining of cobalt.
attributes.background: It was shown on a sky news report this week children taking part in the mining  of cobalt in the Democratic Republic Of Congo. I want the government to take measures to stop this. Multinationals need to source this mineral ethically in the making of batteries for smartphones and laptops.
attributes.additional_details: Only sight the footage shown on a special report done to highlight the children's plight this week March 11th 2017 by Sky News.

attributes.action: There should be a legislation for all hospitals to have post-pay parking system.
attributes.background: When in A&E, so many times you either pay a lot more than the time you actually use the car park. If you pay less, you either have to keep going back to extend parking or you will get a Parking charge notice. It is so unfair for hospitals to charge money for time when parking is not used
attributes.additional_details: When going to A&E you don't know how long you will be waiting before being seen by a consultant. So many times you either pay a lot more than the time you actually use the car park. If you pay less, you either have to keep going back to extend parking or you will get a Parking charge notice. It is so unfair for hospitals to charge money from you for the time you are not even using the parking. A system with ANPR where you only pay for the time you have used the parking will be fairer.

attributes.action: All schools in the U.K. to employ an anti bullying officer/mediator.
attributes.background: I want to try to achieve to get implemented in schools a anti bullying officer/mediator appointed solely for that role in every school... they don't need a teaching degree it would help the children the school and the burden on other teachers.
attributes.additional_details: My child was severy bullied for a few years I could never get to speak to anyone at schools they was always busy my son was suicidal and he got no support. The problem is never tried to be fixed schools hope it will blow over and go away. Teachers aren't fully trained to look out for signals of a bullied child. I believe a person appointed to solely deal with all aspects of bullying within schools will massively reduce bullying statistics!and give teachers the time to teach!

attributes.action: Introduce Nutrition as a core subject to the National Curriculum
attributes.background: With the ongoing and ever increasing obesity epidemic, young people need to be educated in how to keep their bodies healthy from an early age. By educating them and getting them excited about food and nutrition, I hope that we can help to solve this crisis.
attributes.additional_details: In 2015/16 the National Child Measurement Programme revealed that 19.8% of children in Year 6 were obese and a further 14.3% were overweight. Overweight and obese children are likely to become overweight adults and continue to have an increased risk of developing various physical, emotional and psychological problems. The government needs to act now to help solve this crisis by educating the young people of the UK so they are fully informed of how to keep themselves healthy.

attributes.action: Make St. David's day (March 1st) a public holiday in Wales
attributes.background: I believe that St. David's day should be a public holiday for the Welsh. This was declined by Tony Blair in the past even though a majority (87%!) Wanted the change.

attributes.action: Reduce the house of Lords to an equal number of MP
attributes.background:
How can so many unqualified people who are unelected have a direct influence over policy made by elected MPs? 
Reducing the numbers will save huge costs and leave qualified people who are accountable to Parliament. There should never be more Lords than MPs.
attributes.additional_details: Members of Lords to be selected by committee every 4 years

attributes.action: Legislate so children can get hot meals free during school holidays
attributes.background: Children on free school meals are not able to access food 170 days a year during school holidays and are going hungry

attributes.action: I want you to to make it law that all Cats & Kittens to be microchipped.
attributes.background: With so many Cats being killed in road traffic accidents, then being discarded by most councils as waste. Many people want to know what has happened to their pet, whether killed in a road accident or lost.

attributes.action: Stop married personnel paying for own home and camp accommodation
attributes.background: Currently the army charges married personnel for camp accommodation if they own a permenant family home until they over the age of 37
attributes.additional_details: I'm currently serving in the British Army attached to the Navy, as I bought my own home I have to commute every weekend. Within the navy married personnel who own and live in a house do not require to pay for camp accommodation. But Army policy you have to pay for accommodation until you are 37 which I believe is unfair.  As the reason why serving members need the accommodation is to allow them a place to sleep and administrate whilst away from their personal home.

attributes.action: Ban the importation and distribution of all dyed fish.
attributes.background: Dyeing fish is completely unatural and inhumane. Fish that have been injected with these dyes suffer a dramatically shortened life span and are much more susceptible to infection and disease. It is said that in most cases only 50% of fish actually survive the procedure.
attributes.additional_details: Reference - http://www.pets4homes.co.uk/pet-advice/the-phenomenon-of-dyed-fish-and-how-to-avoid-it.html

attributes.action: Tougher sentences for theft of tools from vans and  people that sell them
attributes.background: After having my vehicle broke into twice in the same amount of weeks I think it's about time the government did something to deter these thieves

attributes.action: UK government vote of no confidence.
attributes.background:
lets send a strong massage to the torries that we have no confidence 
 in them to run our affairs in Scotland and UK wide.
we demand as one people the conservative party steps down.

attributes.action: Reform the law to secure greater equality for transgender and non-binary people
attributes.background:
Trans and non-binary people face inequality in the law and unacceptable levels of discrimination in society. 

The UK government must reform the law to extend discrimination protections, improve gender recognition rights, and give the Scottish Parliament powers to protect & extend LGBTI equality.
attributes.additional_details:
Specifically this petition calls on the UK government to:
 
• Update the Equality Act 2010 to ensure all trans and non-binary people are fully protected from discrimination.
 
• Reform the Gender Recognition Act 2004 in line with international best practice, and scrap the spousal veto, to ensure all trans and non-binary people are able to access their human right to legal gender recognition.
 
• Devolve equality law to Scotland so the Scottish Parliament can protect and extend LGBTI equality.

attributes.action: Bring back the YTS scheme for the many small businesses.
attributes.background: I am a blacksmith (I am 54), i would love to pass on my skills and keep teach a young person the ropes, however as a small business myself, we just break even as i have invested all our profit into new equipment, i looked into having an apprentice and its currently impossible

attributes.action: Make it illegal to smoke in the uk for everyone born after 2020 Save our kids.
attributes.background:
Cigarette smoking harms nearly every organ of the body, causes many diseases, and reduces the health of smokers in general.1,2
Quitting smoking lowers your risk for smoking-related diseases and can add years to your life.
attributes.additional_details:
Nhs loses tax revenue from lost productivity when people are made ill by smoking. Conditions caused by smoking cost the NHS billions.
The cost of treating smokers in England was estimated at £2.7 billion in 2006. And that was 10 years ago just think how much it costs the NHS now

attributes.action: Give the people of the UK a veto (by referendum) of any trade deal
attributes.background:
The withdrawal of the UK from the EU will leave us in a position where unsafe trade deals could be made threatening the sovereignty of the UK over governance and standards of products and services.
The people of the UK need a deciding voice in any deal before it is enacted

attributes.action: Assaults on emergency personnel the same penalty as assaulting a police officer
attributes.background: Members of the emergency services are being assaulted. This should not be tolerated and should be felt with as severely as Assaulting a Police Officer. This type of abuse must be severely dealt with.
attributes.additional_details: Having known personnel in the emergency service and hearing they are abused nearly everyday.  We have a duty to support them like they do us, when we need them to save our lives.

attributes.action: Include MPs from all political parties in the negotiations team for Brexit
attributes.background: The negotiated results will be permanent and are too important to be subject to party politics.  Approaches to strategy and policy could be designed to make sure no one party would be able to obstruct the process. It would help to re-unite the UK and lead to a better outcome for all of us.

attributes.action: Allow Tax Relief on Commuting to Work Costs
attributes.background:
Allow commuters to claim income tax relief on the cost of travelling to work. 
Commuters spend their own money to travel to work. Fuel & public transport costs rise and it costs more per year to get to work. 
▼More details
attributes.additional_details:
House prices force people out of areas & make more expensive commutes. Where workers live & where companies are located could be positively influenced by such a move.

If all workers had the opportunity to claim tax relief on their annual commute this would ease the housing market, create job mobility and employment in more regions. 
It is unfair, unreasonable & damaging to the mindset of all employees that they are taxed to go to work. It is an unfair burden on hard working people.

attributes.action: Make the licencing fee for the BBC optional.
attributes.background: The BBC has an obvious left wing agenda, I don't watch the BBC but because I have the ability to receive it, forces me to pay for it, Surely in this age of technology it can be a "Pay per view" channel.

attributes.action: Change the law from late miscarriage to stillbirth.
attributes.background: I myself have had a stillbirth at 34 weeks just 9 month ago and I was outraged to discover that any children born before 24 weeks are categorised as a miscarriage. I want this changed.
attributes.additional_details: Many people don't realise that at this time the mother must give birth to their baby which is often fully formed. They hold them, love them and name them and yet they are non existent is the eyes of the law. They will not be offered a birth or death certificate or a funeral. This is heart breaking for the parents and family. I would like the law changed from miscarriage to still birth from the day any mother has to physically give birth to a baby.

attributes.action: Senior Ministers should be available to mainstream media during crises...
attributes.background:
With self-evident crises (like the NHS or Southern Rail) the Minister with that brief should be directly answerable. 
I have lost count of the number of times I've heard phrases like 'we asked for a comment but no one was available.'
attributes.additional_details:
Clearly we don't need to interrogate Ministers on their shoes or their trousers (leather or not) - this would be petty. 
When something serious is unfolding, however, they should be immediately available and answerable.
Some Ministers (eg Jeremy Hunt) seem to see their job as some kind of sinecure: not good enough. 
We don't need written statements - they can't be interrogated. Nor a junior sacrificial lamb (eg Chris Philp). We need the Minister with overall responsibility.

attributes.action: Introduce a phased ban on multiple point fishing hooks for all leisure angling
attributes.background: For future generations, the welfare and conservation of all native fish species will benefit from a phased UK ban on multiple point hooks for all leisure (sea, coarse and game) angling. This petition proposes to change government policy, restricting anglers to using one single fishing hook per rod.
attributes.additional_details: Leisure angling is one of our biggest recreational pastimes. Whether as a requirement or personal preference, fish should be returned to the water quickly and unharmed. Whilst conservation measures, including a ban on lead weights, help to protect native fish and other wildlife, leisure angling’s use of multiple point hooks remains its Achilles heel. Removal is more time consuming, increases fish stress and the likelihood of harm or death. There are no grounds for defending multiple point hooks.

attributes.action: Make it 'illegal' to setup None Legal Encampment's, with the Police given Powers
attributes.background:
The Police must be given the Powers to Remove people as they Arrive, it should not be for the Councils and Land Owners to Waste money taking Action, also any Mess/Damage must be got from the ones who caused it like breaking in, and Human Waste.
At this time it is Unfair that Council Money is Waste
attributes.additional_details:
Some in the Traveling sector cause issues with Locals, Fly Tip, our council plus the City council have had to pay out good money in Repairs with one area which a school uses closed for eight days cleaning up their mess and repairs to the grass area, another they lifted out posts to a play area, cut chains on gates Only to be moved on to do the same again, No Law in this practice.

Let's make the Laws apply to All.

attributes.action: Increase Employee National Insurance by 1%
attributes.background: Increase Employee National Insurance by 1% to be used exclusively for the NHS & Social Care. With the NHS and Social Care in turmoil both facing unprecedented funding shortages, it is time for the UK workforce to help further fund these services.
attributes.additional_details: Polling has shown that 48% would support a 1% increase in national insurance contributions to go towards the NHS and Social Care.

attributes.action: Introduce a 'Safe Haven' law for abandoned babies in the UK
attributes.background: Around 500 babies are abandoned each year in the UK, that's 9 a week! Here in the UK its currently illegal to leave a baby in a safe place if the parent feels they can no longer look after them, but in all 50 states of America they have a 'Safe haven' law to protect vulnerable children and parents
attributes.additional_details:
The safe haven law allows unharmed children under 3 weeks of age to be surrendered anonymously and safely to a designated place with no questions asked. This insures that babies are not abandoned in cold or dangerous conditions or worse still neglected. 
Whilst this is a highly emotive issue, this law will not encourage pregnant women to abandon their children, what it will do is protect societies most venerable and those that need it most the babies. Please help me protect the these babies.

attributes.action: Make universal credit phone numbers free
attributes.background: Sign this because it is ridiculous to phone up for help with benefits and money and to have a huge phone bill at the end!

attributes.action: Redirect the estate of those who die intestate from Prince Charles to the NHS.
attributes.background: Currently Prince Charles receives the estate of those dying intestate (without a will or any relevant surviving relatives) in Cornwall. This petition requests the law is changed so that money is given to the NHS rather than to the prince.

attributes.action: Consider a Nationalised, funded Mental Health First Response Service.
attributes.background: UK Police Forces and NHS services now spend around 30% of their time responding to Mental Health sufferers who do not receive the best attention or assistance. A MH Service that are the first responders to Suicide risks and Sectioning requests, who can convey MH Patients to the correct facilities.
attributes.additional_details:
Working in the Police, it is being increasingly more and more difficult to tackle Crime and deal with Community issues, when every 3 or 4 of 10 incidents we are responding to are for Mental Health patients that require specialised help that we cannot provide. 
This is tying up Emergency resourcing that can be better used elsewhere, and would provide MH patients with the best care and help possible.
Sectioning people and attending Suicide Risks would be better dealt by more a appropriate agency

attributes.action: Fly the Union Flag on Government Buildings on Armistice Day
attributes.background:
Current recommendations from the Department for Culture, Media and Sport do not require government buildings to fly the Union Flag on Armistice Day, 11th November.
It is recommended for Remembrance Sunday, but the omission of Armistice Day from the list is an oversight that should be corrected.
attributes.additional_details:
Armistice Day is 11 November. We pause to observe the Two Minute Silence at 11:00 on this day every year because at the 11th hour, on the 11th day of the 11th month in 1918, World War I ended. During this time, we remember those who have made sacrifices for the freedom we enjoy today.

The British Legion recommends flying the flag on Armistice Day.

http://support.britishlegion.org.uk/app/answers/detail/a_id/263/~/remembrance-faqs
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/designated-days-for-union-flag-flying

attributes.action: Private companies must allow 10 minutes before issue of a parking invoice.
attributes.background: Many retail parks, housing developments and busimesses use private parking companies to control parking in their carparks or roads. We believe these companies should be legally required to allow the driver to overstay by a maximum of ten minutes, just as traffic wardens and council wardens have to.
attributes.additional_details: If you are held up at the till because there are not enough staff at the checkouts, is it fair to be charged by the parking company that the store employs? Is it right to receive a ticket because you pulled up at your door to unload shopping before taking your car to the official car park? No, it isn't. These charges are exhorbitant and unfair. They should have to allow at least a few minutes grace before pouncing and issuing a fine.

attributes.action: Reverse the decision to close St Bart's Hospital, Rochester, Kent.
attributes.background: There is a lack of provisions in the Medway Towns as it is and we need this hospital. It was used as a rehab hospital for stroke patients and anyone else who needed a longer stay in the hospital. Medway Maritime Hospital will only allow people to stay short term as they need the beds.
attributes.additional_details:
Here is a brief history of the hospital; this is one of the oldest hospitals in Britain, having been founded in 1078 by Gundulph, Bishop of Rochester, for the "poor and leprous". The current hospital building in New Road, Rochester was built in 1861.  The hospital relied on charity donations until 1948 when it was funded by the NHS.

We don't want this historic building to end up in the wrong hands because they may demolish this gothic style building and a piece of Medway history will be gone!

attributes.action: Start making Gazumping Illegal.
attributes.background: We put in an offer for a House about 3 weeks ago it got accepted. Mortgage approved everything. Then Tuesday 1st November 2016 got told that someone put in a Higher  offer and that got accepted. So now left High and Dry.
attributes.additional_details: We don't want this happening to other people

attributes.action: Release Sharbat Gula
attributes.background:
The “Afghan Girl” who graced an iconic cover of National Geographic magazine in 1985 has been arrested in Pakistan on charges of being in the country illegally.

I call upon the UK government to ask for an immediate release of Sharbat Gula.

I request everyone to sign and share the petition.
attributes.additional_details: Sharbat Gula was 12 years old when she was photographed by Steve McCurry in a refugee camp in Pakistan, in December 1984. The haunting image of the green-eyed girl became an international symbol of refugees and of political and social unrest in the region. It has been widely reproduced, making her one of the most recognizable non-celebrity faces of the 20th century.

attributes.action: make the dartford tunnel/crossing free when traffic jams are a mile back.
attributes.background:
To make the dartford tunnel/crossing free when tailback/traffic jams are a mile back.
We shouldn't have to pay for something that should've been free years ago.
The highways agency and sanef should sort this out.
Doing away with the barriers has made traffic tailbacks worse!

attributes.action: Ban the sale of alcohol due to the health and social risk of this drug
attributes.background: I'm doing this due to the fact our government won't allow a plant to be made legal yet they are happy to allow alcohol to destroy lives.

attributes.action: Ensure stiles, located along Public Right of Ways, enable dogs to get through.
attributes.background: Since dogs have been taken on highways since time immemorial, it’s generally assumed that they can be considered a ‘natural accompaniment’ and that therefore dogs can be taken on public rights of way.
attributes.additional_details: Despite the fact that a dog is a ‘natural accompaniment’ to users of rights of way, the law doesn’t require stiles to be ‘dog friendly’ as it’s the dog’s keeper who has the right of passage, not the dog. Stiles with ‘dog latches’ or 'dog gates' can however be provided and can occasionally be seen in popular dog-walking areas but only in certain parts of the UK.

attributes.action: Cap young drivers' insurance at £1200
attributes.background: More and more young drivers are taking the roads hour by hour day by day and the last thing they want to see is an insurance quote ranging from £1500 to as much as £4500 - young drivers can't afford this amount of money just to be able to drive so if we cap it at £1200 it is a more reasonable price.

attributes.action: Investigate if Chechnya is arresting gay citizens and detaining them in camps.
attributes.background:
Reports from Chechnya say that gay men are being arrested and detained in concentration-style camps “in connection with their non-traditional sexual orientation, or suspicion of such” as part of a purge.
The UK government needs to rigorously investigate these reports and intervene if they are true.
attributes.additional_details:
This news story from Pink News explains the details of the reports.

http://www.pinknews.co.uk/2017/04/10/chechnya-has-opened-concentration-camps-for-gay-men/

attributes.action: Ban fixed odds betting terminals because they ruin lives and split up families.
attributes.background: Please address the social problem of fixed odds betting terminals. The protection  that bookmakers offer is inadequate. They literally take the food out of children's mouths and clothes off of their backs.
attributes.additional_details:
In a society which is more fluid and which travels a lot more for work the threat of addiction to gambling is ever present. 
It is possible to gamble 1000s in a matter of minutes. 
With our high streets also suffering, please let's direct this disposable income in the right direction, and end this social poison.

attributes.action: All foreign aid to be stopped and put into hospitals, schools police, homeless.
attributes.background:
Hospital struggling not enough funding 
Schools not enough funding
Police ambulance fire brigade not enough funding . Make Britain proud put our people first make us great Britain

attributes.action: STUDENT ON WORK PLACEMENT SHOULD BE ABLE TO APPLY IN THE UK TO EXTEND THEIR VISA
attributes.background: UKBA recently changed the rules allowing Tier 4 students who decides to have Assessed Work Placement as part of their degree to remain in the UK, if they wish, to apply for Visa extension to complete their study.Under the new rule, they've to go home to make fresh application to complete their study
attributes.additional_details: The new rule is an unnessary one leading to financial burden and the high risk of traveling back home for students. Afterall, Work Placement, where available as an option on a degree course, is assessed by Higher Education Institutions, and a work placement in the industry is often time, offered to only bright students. No doubt, Work Placement contributes to human capital development and, enhances academic performance too; the Home office should not discourage it by imposing pointless rules.

attributes.action: Change NHS Policy on action on pregnancy reduced movements.
attributes.background:
Pregnancy is a difficult and worrying time for any parent and mums are constantly told to watch their babies movements. 
Sadly some hospitals policies are still that you have to be 28 weeks to be monitored or scanned, only a heartbeat will be checked. This needs to change.
attributes.additional_details:
I was a healthy pregnancy until 25 weeks. My babies movements started to decrease and I let professionals know, but I wasn't listened to. 
I knew her pattern, I knew she wasn't moving as much. I soon discovered our hospitals policy along with other hospitals is 28 weeks to be scanned. 
My little girl died 27+5 due to failing placenta which a scan would have picked up and saved her! I now know I am not alone with this. 
Please help lower the policy to viability age and save other babies!

attributes.action: Give people with Crohns & Colitis eligibility for a Blue Badge
attributes.background: People with Inflammatory Bowel Disease often refer to it as an 'Invisible Illness', as you cannot always see how much we are affected and it strikes everyone so differently in unpredictable ways. Often, we need quick and discreet access to a bathroom in order to avoid an embarrassing accident.
attributes.additional_details: Being an Autoimmune Disease, IBD affects almost every part of your body. Many require a bag after surgery, so quick & easy access to a bathroom is a must have, which is difficult when finding a place to park. I have Crohns Disease, and often I require a bathroom at short notice, or struggle to walk far because I am using crutches. Being entitled to receive a blue badge when you have IBD is so important to help us maintain our dignity from an illness which so often causes pain and embarrassment.

attributes.action: Bring in laws to stop travellers from parking up on private estates.
attributes.background: Travellers are taking the proverbial by continually setting up camps on private industrial estates in order to extort money for leaving premises.
attributes.additional_details: Major problems in Peterborough, Cambridgeshire
